title: Open source tracking and data capture
body:
1. install fingerprint is not sent on normal events. Let's include that so we can correlate events better
2. we are not capturing any user sign up info (in open source)

We should capture that user info
* security updates
* licensing updates
* product updates, review requests etc

Context
Right now we prompt for this information. So the user actually thinks they are giving it to us already. BUT we don't transmit it. (becuase no write key, and in our prior setup it was never an issue (our own db) so the data we sent `identify_user()` was just "extra")

`identify_user()` is only run once, not with every event.
we could do an event hub event to capture this, perhaps a JSON log
https://github.com/diffgram/diffgram/blob/e86dd34685a41aca5e131bdc7a4fd0fa0a6058b4/shared/database/event/event.py#L370

we also may want to think trade offs of exposing a (different?) segment analytics write key. Not sure what the risks would be exactly but at least that would give us that tracking too
